notes:
# Power # 
🪡 **Threads of Fate** - In my opinion, if you don’t start with Threads of Fate, you start off wrong. This power is the best one hands down. You are immediately 50% more effective with both damage boost and healing for the first two rounds and that is more than ANY other power or item can give you.

# Items #
🔫 **Compensator** - 5% Weapon Power, this is the best 1k item you can get.

⛽️ **Weapon Grease** - 5% Attack Speed, this is the second best 1k item you can get.

⛑️ **First Aid Kit** - 25 Shields + 33% time reduction on your self healing. This is the best survivability tool outside of Blessed Boosters. As Mercy, you are a little gnat constantly flying around and line of sighting everyone so that you don’t die. This gives you an extra 25 regenerating shield and faster recovery for your support passive which Mercy relies greatly on as your second support will usually struggle to heal you.

## I DO NOT Recommend: ##
❌ **Running Shoes (1,000)** - This item is useless on spawn as you have GA to assist you, its only use is on respawns and returning you faster to your team. Its only value hinges on you dying. Don’t get it.

❌ **Winning Attitude (1,000)** - This item’s value hinges on you dying. It’s not worth the ultimate charge.

## Option 1: ##
If you were **NOT** the last person standing in your teamfights, get *Blessed Boosters* and anything else you can afford using the mid-game item list.

🙏 **Blessed Boosters** - Gives you the best survivability possible for only one item slot with its speed and repositioning potential. It may not be everyone’s favorite, but it’s definitely mine.


## Option 2: ##
If you were the last person to die in your teamfights, or if you never died at all… **Congrats!** You probably have pretty good positioning and may not need to rely on Blessed Boosters to keep you alive for one more round. Build as much weapon power/attack speed as you possibly can using the mid-game item list. Try to keep the stats even with each other.


## I DO NOT Recommend: ##
❌ **Icy Coolant (5,000)** - 10% Weapon Power + 10% CD Reduction (CD Reduction is not the focus on this build and is really only valuable for rez-based builds. There are better things to buy with your cash.)

❌ **Mid-Air Mobilizer (4,000)** - 5% Weapon Power + 10% Attack Speed (Only usable while in the air - I don’t normally recommend this as it encourages bad play, being in the air leaves you a sitting duck for any hitscan.)

# Power #
🏥 **Triage Unit** -  If your co-healer is focusing more on damage and your poor tank is on the floor more often than not, take Triage Unit. Prepare to become a left-click Andy. 

🪖 **Battle Medic** - If your team’s damage sucks,  you’re not getting anywhere with blue beaming, and you have decent aim - take Battle Medic. Glock ‘em down. 

## I DO NOT Recommend: ##
❌ **Crepuscular Circle** - I do not recommend taking Crepuscular Circle this early in the game. It’s a fantastic power, but as a lot of people are about to get a huge power spike, Triage Unit is the extra healing needed to match it. 


# End-Game Item List #
This is the default list of items you should aim for. Please do the math and make sure you’re getting the best bang for your buck with the cash you have.

🙏 **Blessed Boosters** - Best repositioning/survival tool. Take it before you regret it.

👁️ **Eye of the Spider** - 25% Weapon Power, this is huge.

💉**Amari’s Antidote** - 15% Weapon Power (30% Weapon power when healing someone below half), excellent item.

🚪 **The Closer** - 20% Weapon Power, an excellent stat item.

🛩️ **Booster Jets** - 20% Attack Speed + 20% ground speed for 2 sec after you land your GA, this is your main source of Attack Speed, try to get this sooner rather than later.

⛓️ **Chain Evoker** - 5% Damage Boost increase + 15% Damage Boost to your Ultimate Charge. If a dps is hard carrying your game, get this item sooner rather than later.

## I DO NOT Recommend: ##
❌ **Caduceus Ex (10,000)** - While its staff range is useful, it’s only a 10% weapon power increase. If you are struggling with positioning and staying close to your team whilst also being safe, consider using it, but be aware you may be hurting yourself in the long run.

❌ **Hardlight Accelerator (11,000)** - 10% CD Reduction + 10% Weapon Power (Possibly 25% Weapon Power). I do not recommend this item as it encourages wasting GA whilst the Closer is a more reliable item.

❌ **Vanadium Injection (10,000)** - 50 Shields + Little bit of everything when at 100% Ult. I do not recommend this because holding onto Valkyries in the Stadium is really bad. You charge Valkyrie so fast there is no reason not to wait. You should be building one per fight.

# Power #
🔆 **Crepuscular Circle** This turns your fairly crappy Valkyrie into a pretty good Ultimate ability. With the items boosting your healing/damage boost, you should be farming out an Ultimate every teamfight and this is when Crepuscular Circle comes into play. Make sure you keep your teammates in your line of sight so they get your affects - whip out the barbie blaster and give those pesky dps a taste of their own medicine.

# Power #
🪖 **Battle Medic**- If you have any sort of aim, take this power. You will be an absolute monster when you go into Valkyrie with full stacks. 60% Attack Speed + 60% Weapon Power - you can absolutely murder an entire team if your aim is on point. 

🍺 **Glass Extra Full** - If you are terrified to aim and prefer to forget that your sidearm exists, don’t bother with Battle Medic and take this extra healing instead. Remember to always heal up all your teammates in spawn before the fight starts so get the additional overhealth.
